Package pl.edu.agh.kis.pz1.model

Class HandCompare

java.lang.Object
pl.edu.agh.kis.pz1.model.HandCompare
public class HandCompare extends Object
Class responsible for comparing poker hands and determining the winner. This class provides methods for evaluating the rank of a hand and determining the best hand among a list of players based on poker hand rankings.

  • Constructor Details

    • HandCompare

      public HandCompare()

  • Method Details

    • checkHand

      public HandRank checkHand(List<Card> hand)
      Evaluates the hand and returns its rank. The method sorts the cards by rank and checks for the presence of various hand types (Royal Flush, Straight Flush, Four of a Kind, etc.). It then returns the appropriate HandRank object with the hand's type and kickers, if applicable. Kickers are used to break ties between hands of the same type.
      Parameters:
      hand - The list of cards representing the player's hand.
      Returns:
      A HandRank object representing the evaluated hand's type and kickers.

    • determineWinner

      public Player determineWinner(List<Player> players)
      Determines the winner among a list of players by comparing their hands. The method checks each player's hand and evaluates its rank using the `checkHand` method. It then compares each hand to find the highest ranked hand and returns the player with that hand.
      Parameters:
      players - The list of players to evaluate.
      Returns:
      The player with the best hand, based on the hand rankings.

    • isRoyalFlush

      public boolean isRoyalFlush(List<Card> hand)
      Checks if the hand is a Royal Flush. A Royal Flush consists of a straight flush with the highest possible cards: Ten to Ace. This method checks if the hand is both a flush and a straight, and if it includes the Ace and Ten.
      Parameters:
      hand - The list of cards representing the player's hand.
      Returns:
      True if the hand is a Royal Flush, false otherwise.

    • isStraightFlush

      public boolean isStraightFlush(List<Card> hand)
      Checks if the hand is a Straight Flush. A Straight Flush consists of five consecutive cards in the same suit. This method checks if the hand is both a flush and a straight.
      Parameters:
      hand - The list of cards representing the player's hand.
      Returns:
      True if the hand is a Straight Flush, false otherwise.

    • isFlush

      public boolean isFlush(List<Card> hand)
      Checks if the hand is a Flush. A Flush consists of five cards of the same suit, regardless of their order. This method checks if all cards in the hand share the same suit.
      Parameters:
      hand - The list of cards representing the player's hand.
      Returns:
      True if the hand is a Flush, false otherwise.

    • isStraight

      public boolean isStraight(List<Card> hand)
      Checks if the hand is a Straight. A Straight consists of five consecutive cards in any suit. This method verifies if the ranks of the cards form a sequence of consecutive values.
      Parameters:
      hand - The list of cards representing the player's hand.
      Returns:
      True if the hand is a Straight, false otherwise.

    • isFourOfAKind

      public boolean isFourOfAKind(List<Card> hand)
      Checks if the hand is a Four of a Kind. A Four of a Kind consists of four cards with the same rank. This method checks if any four consecutive cards have the same rank.
      Parameters:
      hand - The list of cards representing the player's hand.
      Returns:
      True if the hand is a Four of a Kind, false otherwise.

    • isFullHouse

      public boolean isFullHouse(List<Card> hand)
      Checks if the hand is a Full House. A Full House consists of three cards of one rank and two cards of another rank. This method verifies two possible Full House patterns: three cards of one rank followed by two of another, or two cards of one rank followed by three of another.
      Parameters:
      hand - The list of cards representing the player's hand.
      Returns:
      True if the hand is a Full House, false otherwise.

    • isThreeOfAKind

      public boolean isThreeOfAKind(List<Card> hand)
      Checks if the hand is a Three of a Kind. A Three of a Kind consists of three cards of the same rank, plus two other different cards. This method checks if any set of three consecutive cards have the same rank.
      Parameters:
      hand - The list of cards representing the player's hand.
      Returns:
      True if the hand is a Three of a Kind, false otherwise.

    • isTwoPair

      public boolean isTwoPair(List<Card> hand)
      Checks if the hand is Two Pair. A Two Pair consists of two cards of one rank, two cards of another rank, and one kicker card. This method verifies if there are exactly two pairs in the hand.
      Parameters:
      hand - The list of cards representing the player's hand.
      Returns:
      True if the hand is Two Pair, false otherwise.

    • isOnePair

      public boolean isOnePair(List<Card> hand)
      Checks if the hand is One Pair. A One Pair consists of two cards of the same rank, and three other cards as kickers. This method verifies if there is exactly one pair in the hand.
      Parameters:
      hand - The list of cards representing the player's hand.
      Returns:
      True if the hand is One Pair, false otherwise.

    • compareHandRank

      public int compareHandRank(HandRank h1, HandRank h2)
      Compares two HandRank objects. This method compares the types of the hands first. If the types are the same, it compares the kickers in descending order.
      Parameters:
      h1 - The first HandRank to compare.
      h2 - The second HandRank to compare.
      Returns:
      A positive number if h1 is better, a negative number if h2 is better, or 0 if they are equal.
